content:
Welcome to Mini 1514: ETL's Royal Council!

The kingdom of Bayoth was in deep unrest. The king had died without an heir, which had never happened in the history of this land. The royal advisor, the late king's right hand, sat in the now empty court, wondering how he would deal with this situation. He realized the lords of each realm in the kingdom would soon begin to lay claims to the throne. Most of them, he knew, would loyally give allegiance to whoever the advisor chose, but others would not be so easily appeased. Some would seek to eliminate the competition - violently.

To avoid a civil war, he invited each of them to a private council at the palace. As the last lord arrived, the gates were sealed and the last of the guards took their place along the wall. None remained inside, save for the advisor and 14 lords of Bayoth. The council would begin at dawn.

The following morning, the advisor woke to sounds of shouting in the courtyard. One of the lords had been murdered in the night, and now there remained only 13. Before a king could be chosen, the murderers would need to be caught.

This game is currently in END GAME.

Rules
* Stolen from Equinox <3 (and bits/pieces from other awesome mods)*

All rules listed in the Boilerplate Mafiascum Game Rules page apply to this game except where contradicted in the additional rules below, in which case the following rules will take precedence:

Game-play:
  1. Blue is reserved for the moderator. All other formatting is fair game with the provision that you do not impersonate me.

  2. Flavor is for entertainment purposes only and has no significance in the game.

  3. Votes must be cast using this format:
    Code: Select all
    [b]Vote:ETL[/b]
    or by using the VOTE: tags, like this:
    Code: Select all
    [vote]ETL[/vote]
    If it looks like you're voting, it will be counted. You may UNVOTE: before changing your vote, but it is not necessary. If you wish to remove your vote entirely, you must UNVOTE: . You may also vote not to lynch anyone by voting for a No Lynch, like this VOTE: No Lynch or VOTE: NL.

  4. Lynches occur through simple majority (50% of living players + 1, rounded down). A No Lynch can be reached the same way. If no majority is reached at deadline, the Day will end without a lynch. Once majority is reached, no further votes or unvotes will count.

  5. All players, including the lynched player, are allowed to discuss in twilight phase until I post the death scene. Day ends when the moderator locks the thread.

  6. Dead players may make one "Bah!" post that does NOT contain any game information. If you think it might, leave it out. Things like, "Go town!" or "Bah!" are acceptable.

Player Conduct:
  1. Prods will be issued to players if they have not posted within a 48-hour period. Players who have been prodded have 48 hours to make a game-related post in the game thread before a replacement is sought. If the prod is not opened within 24 hours, I will seek a replacement sooner.

  2. There is no third prod; players requiring a third prod will be replaced immediately.

  3. Insults, personal attacks, obscene name calling, and general bad behavior will not be tolerated and will result in force-replacement. Don't tempt fate; just play nice.

  4. Please don't ask me to replace you because you don't like someone. Take a moment to review the player list before the game begins and use your best judgement. I would prefer to replace players only when absolutely necessary to maintain the flow of the game.

Deadlines and Night Actions:
  1. Days will have a deadline of two weeks, and Nights will last 48 hours. Deadline extensions will be granted only in extreme circumstances. Not being able to make up your mind is not an extreme circumstance.

  2. If I do not receive your action by deadline, the action is forfeited. You may submit ahead of time. You can also make as many changes as necessary, and at deadline I will take the last action you submitted. Actions may be submitted via PM or bolded in a QuickTopic.

  3. All actions will be processed according to Natural Action Resolution.

Miscellaneous:
  1. I am human and fallible. If I've made a mistake, you can let me know by PM or a quick (bolded) post in-thread.

  2. Please bold anything you wish me to see.

  3. Any situation not covered above will be handled on a case-by-case basis.

Sample Role PM

Welcome to MINI 1481, XXX!

You are a Vanilla Townie.

You have no special abilities beyond the right to vote.

You win when all threats to the town have been eliminated and at least one member of the town remains standing.

The game thread is [url]here[/url]. Please confirm in the game thread.

Role PMs going out now. All role PMs have been sent! Please confirm in-thread. Votes placed prior to day start will not be counted. Once 10/13 have confirmed, the game will start. Any players not confirmed by the confirmation deadline will be replaced before Day 1 begins.

The deadline for confirmation is Tuesday, October 29, 2013 at 19:00 EST, which is in (expired on 2013-10-29 19:00:00).

12/13 have confirmed.

In post 214, Dessew wrote:Forgot: Crayon actually saw those semi-serious reasons, it also bothers me.

I'm happy to address this point by explaining my approach to the RVS stage, which will hopefully make clear how and why I saw the "semi-serious" tone of his vote. I will note, however, that I don't think that that post is particularly important in and of itself -- at the time, I found Klazam's reaction posts more off putting. (And as of now Klazam has sort of dropped off my radar, though I was uneasy with his potential buddying.)


Anyways:

I personally look for some reason to vote for someone during the RVS, even though it's going to be pretty flimsy as an early vote. I know most people don't do this, and I don't hold it against them -- nor do I typically share my reasoning, because I don't find it to be particularly helpful. It is, after all, the RVS, and my "reason" is usually not a very good one. It just makes me feel better to know that I'm voting based on something more than pure randomness.

So, when someone puts out a reason for a RVS that's not an obvious joke, I take it to be a sign that they want to share with the class a reason that has moved beyond a "lolRVS" basis -- even if it is pretty flimsy.

The posting-after-being-called-out justification for Klazam's vote is not on the same level as "scum found, discuss" or "my role pm says he's scum" as you suggested earlier. It's an attempt to justify a vote based on the (very) limited information at that stage of the game, and just because that justification will be naturally weak (due to the limited information available) does not mean it is a "joke." Therefore, even though it was a Page 1 vote, Klazam wanted everyone to know that his first vote for paschendale was justified not solely based on RVS, but also in part on "confirming right after being called out on <being late to confirm.>"

There's a difference between formal logic and evidence. Correlation is a statistical measure. And being water is correlated with drinkability. If you find out that something is drinkable, this tells you a lot about whether it's water: you can rule out, for example, the possibility that it's freedom.

I suspect, but don't have time to work out the math and I have learned that math is only for analysis not persuasion anyhow, that saying one member of a pair is "more informative" as to the other, in your sense, is equivalent to saying they're the less scummy of the two. Intuitively, you learn more from the lynch of a person you're less sure about. But that is of course not a sufficient reason to not lynch the scummiest person.

I feel like knowing Pasch's alignment who has been saying lots of things about Hermy is in fact relevant to Hermy's alignment. We might consider what in his alignment caused him to say those things.

In my experience, lynching somebody that has said a lot about one person isn't alignment indicative. You can say a lot about a person and be town (in which case you might be right but there's an equal chance that you're misguided), or be scum (in which case you can say whatever the hell you want about the person, or be persuaded to defend them for whatever reason, be them town or scum)

Conversely, you lynch the person that they're talking about. Now the person doing all of the talking has all of this information tied to him that says quite a lot.

You're getting far more information out of a Hermy lynch here, so we can agree to disagree. But as far as logic vs. evidence is concerned, if you don't prefer to look at it that way, at least try to see it from my point of view anyway.

If you believe that this is me straying from the Pasch lynch, you have my promise that I'm likely going to want to lynch Pasch tomorrow no matter what.

Consider the case of X saying "I investigated Y, he's innocent".  In that case, if you lynch Y and he turns up scum, you learn a lot about X.  However, if you lynch X and he turns up town, you also learn a lot about Y!  The two are inextricably intertwined.  The case of a claimed investigation is an extreme example, but the same principle applies in more nebulous circumstances.
When you say "If Hermy is scum, then Paschy is scum", that means that if Pasch is town, Hermy is town.

It also means that Pasch is more likely to be scum than Hermy, because Pasch is scum in every case that Hermy is, as well as some other cases.  Why do you not want to lynch the one that's more likely to be scum?

The night was particularly cold and too silent. The advisor sat grieving over the loss of Hermy and Klazam, and pondered on the connections between Paschendale and Abhorsen. He felt an icy chill run through his bones as he wondered what horrors he would face in the morning. Another restless night, followed by tormented nightmares of murder and a countryside fraught with war.

The following morning held no soothing sunlight as the clouds obscured the sky, casting an eery wash of grey on everything. The stone of the courtyard that had once seemed delicately ornate appeared gruesome and evil. The advisor walked to the fountain to splash water on his face, and found it running red.

Two bodies lay propped against the statue in the center, their faces blue masks of death. "Odd..." he thought to himself, as his eyes turned to the two guns found clasped in each of their hands.

Slandaar, Town Odd-Night Vigilante, died Night 3.
Dessew, Mafia Tracker, died Night 3.

GAME OVER.
Congratulations, Town. You've won!

Some notes on the game from your moderator:
This was a particularly enjoyable game for me to watch, if short. I believe the loss of the roleblocker, Paschendale, was a huge blow to the scum team, but also, that town trusted each other and each claim so closely. I had anticipated the claims to cause serious confusion and paranoia, as well as the false positives for the gunsmith. Another aspect to the quickness of the game came from the mafia choosing to target Jingle two nights in a row. Interestingly enough, I believe it was Dessew, who mused he could be a hider, but quickly discarded that idea. I also feel that the activity level of the scum team attributed greatly to town's ability to confirm each other and form a solid town block.

The mafia, in no way, did badly at all, though. Dessew displayed a convincing town POV (imo) throughout D1/D2. I also particularly liked the way Paschendale handled his read of Abhorsen, and Abhorsen's responses to inquiries.

The star of the show, by far, is Jingle. He concealed his Hider status and played the D3 options for night actions very well. I'm really proud of him. He took the role and made it everything I had envisioned for it.

I'd also like to thank my review team: mykonian, JacobSavage and Empking. They put up with my arguing over the balance, but they are wiser than I am, and I should have listened. Town had a ton of unchecked power. I wasn't expecting the RB to go under so quickly. Next time will be better.

Very well done, everyone. Take this time to discuss the game and how you think it could have gone better, ask questions, give advice, and anything else you wish to share. Spectators are also welcome to post at this time.

Thank you to everyone for participating and feeding my own twisted desires for WIFOM and confusion in this setup. <3

I would also welcome any modding advice, if there is anything I could have done differently that you might have liked, or comments on the style/flavor/VCs/rules, etc. Anything you want to say!

I do apologize for any delays that occurred in VCs, or opening/closing the thread. You guys were all pretty active and I only had to make one (requested) replacement. I'd say that's pretty fantastic. Thanks again everyone!
